snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s request would exceed the roughly $12 billion in FEMA disaster aid currently available in Washington without action from Congress, where there is likely to be strong opposition to additional spending.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo plans to ask the federal government for at least $30 billion in disaster aid to help New York City and other affected areas of the state recover from Hurricane Sandy; governor's advisers provide a staggering inventory of need as the city and state continue to rebuild in the storm's deadly wake; tally exceeds the roughly $12 billion in FEMA disaster aid currently available without action from Congress.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Charles V. Bagli, Diane Cardwell, Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Christopher Maag.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s request would exceed the roughly $12 billion in FEMA disaster aid currently available in Washington without action from Congress, where there is likely to be strong opposition to additional spending.
